page.title: 07Village Clubs, Bridgham
page.content:
Our Playing Field Committee raises money to maintain the field and buy equipment; swings, gymnastic set and mower have been bought since l980. The Football Club (formed before the war and meeting regularly since 1947) occupies a position half-way up the Norwich and South Norfolk League.
The Village Hall Committee raises funds to improve the amenities of the village hall. The Social Club runs the bar and organises club activities (see page 9).
The Chapel Corner Club meets monthly and provides tea and entertainment for retired villagers. There is a yearly outing and Christmas Party. The Luncheon Club meets monthly for a dinner cooked by volunteers. About 25 retired villagers are catered for.
